alert.note: Alert for Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 4:40PM EDT until April 05 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Laurens and Union Counties in the South Carolina Upstate. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar was indicating one more round of heavy showers and storms will move across the advised area into early evening. Already today, between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, and up to an additional inch of rain my accumulate. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Union, Clinton, Monarch Mill, Joanna, Cross Hill, Carlisle, Waterloo, Rose Hill State Park, Lake Greenwood, Mountville, Sedalia, Kinards and Santuc. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
